alert.note: Alert for Deltana and Tanana Flats; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 01 at 4:08PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...High Water on the Tanana River and Tributaries Draining the Alaska Range into the Weekend... High water on the Tanana River and tributaries draining the Alaska Range will continue into the weekend. This includes the Chisana River, Nabesna River, Gerstle River, Delta River, and the Nenana River. The Tanana River is running at bankfull. Heavy rain that fell over the south slopes of the Alaska Range from Denali to the Alcan Border since last weekend has caused this high water. More rain occuring over Alaska Range and Tanana Valley through the Saturday. This will cause water levels to remain high on many rivers into early next week. A Flood Advisory is in effect through Noon Sunday from Delta Junction to Fairbanks and through Noon Monday from Nenana to Old Minto. A Flood Watch is in affect through Monday for the Tanana River from Old Minto to Manley Hot Springs. Please see those products for more details.

area.areaDesc: Deltana and Tanana Flats; Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country
